content.webTitle: How are you being affected by the Hong Kong protests?

fields.headline: How are you being affected by the Hong Kong protests?
fields.bodyText: Tens of thousands of protesters have forced Hong Kong’s politicians to abandon a debate on the controversial China extraditions bill. Protesters surrounded the legislative council building and swamped the city centre on Wednesday. Masks and cling film have been handed out by organisers to protect protesters from pepper spray as they faced off with riot police who held up signs warning they were prepared to use force on the crowds to maintain stability. Share your experiences How do you feel about the situation? Are you taking part in the protests? If you are there now you can get in touch, anonymously if you wish, via the encrypted form below – only the Guardian has access to your contributions and we will not publish anything without your permission. One of our journalists may be in touch to discuss your contribution. Please note that while we’d like to hear from you, your security is most important. We recognise it may not always be safe or appropriate to record or share your experiences – so please think about this when considering whether to get in touch with the Guardian. IP addresses will be recorded on a third party webserver, so for true anonymity use our SecureDrop service, however anything submitted on the form below will be encrypted and confidential if you wish to continue. If you’re having trouble using the form, click here. Read terms of service here.
